intro: Jacquemontia grandiflora, commonly known as the large-flowered Jacquemontia, is a member of the Convolvulaceae family. It is a herbaceous perennial plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. The plant features showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink to purple in color. Its vines grow along the ground, often climbing or trailing over other vegetation. The leaves are heart-shaped and covered in fine, hairy textures, contributing to its distinctive appearance.
